description.narrative: 32 Financing Mechanism Identified and Implemented at the pilot units

comment.narrative:
No feasibility or valuation studies in place Sustainable financing mechanisms largely absent from PA system Environmentally economic tools are not systematically applied
Conservation Funds have been looked at in a limited way

Sustainable financing mechanisms assessed and being pursued within at least 3 PA sites as appropriate Community local government and other stakeholders partnerships leads to better management of well designed and managed funds setup sourcing funding from variety of sources including PA income Financial Scorecard score increased to 55 at the end of the project

A Conservation Trust Fund was created for Doi Inthanon National Park with the aim to draw private sector and CSOs supports to PA management For Doi Inthanon a Conservation Trust Fund Committee is chaired by the Chairman of the Hotel Association in Chiang Mai Province wherein Doi Inthanon NP is situated with the participation from local CSOs and academics Moreover the first business plan for PA management has been introduced and developing at this pilot site based on 10 selected prioritized activities from the Doi Inthanon National Park Management Plan following a participatory process In Tarutao the stakeholders consultations to form the Tarutao Conservation Trust Fund based on the diving fee and other tourismrelated revenue have been conducted For EFCOM the financial mechanism will be PES from the Industrial Estate to support the watershed conservation and management of the complex The valuation of water ecosystem services of EFCOM is being conducted and the engagement with the key private sector in the areas is being developed through the PAC platform There is no financial mechanism designed for the subWEFCOM pilot
The Financial Scorecard was assessed in system level The site levels and forest complex were tested by the same scorecard as experimentation in September 2014 The 2014 system levels financial score is 2956 which decreased from 2012 with gained score at 3390 However this decrease can be explained by a misapplication of the scorecard in the baseline exercise and in fact it was acknowledged that the there was a marked improvement since 2012

The Eastern Forest Complexs PAC was recently established by the CATSPA project in close collaboration with Regional Conservation Office No2 Sriracha which has responsibility for 8 protected areas in Eastern Forest Complex In the meantime at the western forest complex and in particular at HKK Klong Lan and Mae Wong work is progressing on buffer zone management involving PAC members in order to reduce impacts from encroachment or nontimber product collection Moreover CATSPA will organize 4 regions PACs lesson learned workshops

description.narrative: 2 Formal DNP management and financial effectiveness capacity programs in place

comment.narrative: Limited formal capacity programs or materials
Specific programs and materials in place

The trainings and capacity building workshops organised under the project remains piecemeal and has not been systematically integrated into the DNP system yet The trainings capacity buildings have been designed around the key themes of CATSPA including sustainable financing financial scorecards Management Effectiveness for PA tools and approaches the economics of biodiversity and ecosystem conservation communication for conservation as well as SMART patrolling The two core curricular drafted last year have not yet been rolling out due to the lack of engagement with the core groups of the Effectiveness Unit and the Training Division of DNP The rapid assessment on training need assessment has been done and it will inform the development of Marine Protected Areas Capacity Building module to support DNPs in the reform of the marine protected area management The consultations with the Training Division The Recreation Division as well as the superintendents of the marine protected areas have been undertaken twice and the outline of the module has been developed
